intro: Rostkovia magellanica f. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf Magellan lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of white or pale pink blooms during the spring and early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is a sought-after plant among horticultural enthusiasts.
